text.section:
Subject to the provisions of this section, the Board may issue a license by reciprocity to practice architecture in the State to an individual who:
is licensed to practice architecture in another state or country; or
is certified by the Council under subsection (c) of this section.

The Board may issue a license by reciprocity under this section for an applicant who is licensed to practice architecture in another state or country only if the applicant:
is of good character and reputation;
pays to the Board:
a nonrefundable application fee set by the Board; and
a license fee set by the Board; and
provides adequate evidence that:
the applicant became licensed in the other state or country after meeting, in that or any other state or country, requirements that were at least equivalent to those then required by the laws of this State; or
at the time of application for a license by reciprocity under this section, the applicant meets the requirements currently required by the laws of this State.

The Board may issue a license by reciprocity under this section for an applicant who is certified by the Council only if:
the applicant:
is of good character and reputation; and
pays to the Board:
a nonrefundable application fee set by the Board; and
a license fee set by the Board; and
the Board receives from the Council a certified copy of its certificate for the applicant that certifies that the applicant is licensed to practice architecture in another state or country.

An architect who is granted a license by reciprocity by the Board may not be required to maintain licensure in any other state or country as a condition of maintaining the license granted by the Board.
